Reason: The _prevalenceDirectory configuration is considered performance-sensitive. This is because the directory where the prevalence data is stored directly impacts the storage and retrieval operations in the system, affecting system performance. The configuration is used in critical methods like journal() and snapshotManager(), which are called frequently during system operations. The choice of directory can impact data access speed, disk I/O operations, and overall system performance. Therefore, any variation in the _prevalenceDirectory configuration can have a substantial effect on system performance at the system level.
